Reviews.Title: “A very good value”
Reviews.Author: Molly J
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Diego on vacation with two adults and a toddler (18 month old). We were looking for something on the beach near Mission Bay or Pacific Beach but didn't want to pay an arm and a leg. We stayed in Diamond Head for about 3 nights. For our price we had a suite that included a kitchen, living room, and separate bedroom. I'd say the pros are the price and the location. For the price the room is very big and we loved the separate living room and bedroom so that when the baby went to sleep we could still be out in the living room with the lights on and such. Also, the hotel was very family friend and provided a pack-n-play type crib which was already set up when we checked in. The location is just amazing. You are steps from the beach and boardwalk and walking distance to lots of restaurants and shops. We did not have any problem with parking and though we didn't use our car much, when we did we never had too much problem finding a space right in front of the hotel. The biggest downside is that the rooms are a little dated and just not that fresh feeling. I wouldn't say it was horrible or unclear necessarily, but the couch in the living room has seen better days and when we checked in I found pieces of peanuts on the carpet. Also the bathroom is fine but small and the room we were in the toilet seat lid was permanently open since the counter top was sitting on top of the lid. Not a huge deal but with an active and curious toddler it was one more thing to remember. The bed was fine but a little saggy in the middle. I'd say overall the strengths are the price and location. The rooms are clean and functional and a nice place to launch your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Way beyond what we expected”
Reviews.Author: bill g
Reviews.Content: I had read the prior reviews and was somewhat concerned about staying at the Diamond Head Inn, long story short, it was great. The staff was very helpful, the rooms were large, parking was never an issue, everything was clean and you are right one the beach. I know there will be doubters but our experience but it was a ten. Thanks to everyone at the DHI, we will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Dana A
Reviews.Content: The Diamond Head Inn exceeded my expectations!! I read tons of reviews on this place and was a little concerned by all the negativity! But the location was amazing, so my boyfriend and I decided to give it a shot, and for the price, it was too good of a deal to pass up. People were saying the, carpet/room dirty, no hot water, no ice machine, loudness of people outside, no parking, rude staff, no one helped with carrying bags, blinds falling apart, etc. None of that is true!!! I had called on our way into town, and the extremely nice lady at the front desk said we could get an early check in. The moment we pulled up, there was tons of parking. Yes the Diamond Head Inn does only have 4 parking spaces reserved for guest only, but along the street, right in front of the Inn, there are about 20 parking spaces. And we found a spot everytime we came back from somewhere. Although you really don't ever need to take your car anywhere, because everything is within walking distance. (But we like to venture out, and cruise down pch!) So we got there, checked in, the lady was extremely helpful; she even walked us to our room to be sure we wouldn't get lost! As soon as we walked into the room, I felt so relieved. You could smell the cleanliness of it, and the carpet was not dirty at all!! I guess this place was renovated about 4+ years ago, but if you ask me it is still in very good condition! The room was beautifully decorated with a bungalow type feel. And no blinds falling apart! When you walk straight into the back of the room, you enter a very nice size kitchen with a table and seating area for about 4 people. It was fully equipped with a refridgerator, microwave, and stove. And all cooking and silverware utensils, along with plates and glasses. The bathroom was extremely clean!! A little on the small side, but definitely did not bother us! As for the ice machine, there isnt one easily accessible, but we did go to the front desk, and the lady said they had some, but because she was so friendly and honest, she said it was most likely old, and told us we could go to the hotel next door and get some from them. She even called over there to let them know we were stopping by to get some. Our stay here was absolutely amazing. We went out during the day, but ended up just staying in at night because it had that nice, warm, cozy feel. We celebrated my boyfriends birthday, Valentines day, aaaandddd he proposed to me here down on the beach!! I am so glad we stayed at this Inn, because it just made all the celebrating that much better!!! This will always be a place we return to, not only for the great memories, but for the wonderful stay that we had here! Thank You to all the staff at the Diamond Head Inn! I hope this review helps a lot of people find their way to this beautiful spot in Pacific Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant rooms on a good location”
Reviews.Author: GeoPhil
Reviews.Content: We: 2 families with adult children We were friendly received by the front desk staff. Here we got in the morning also coffee and muffins for breakfast. Groundfloor Room: Beautifully decorated rooms with a nice kitchen and dining table. The kitchen is equipped with two cooking ranges and several pots and pans. There is a fridge and a big Microwave, plates, cuttleries, a toaster and a coffe maker, etc. The adjacent living room has a sofabed. The bedroom is also stylish decorated. It has 2 large windows facing public walk paths and therefore we couldn't open the shutters. Only one bedside light was working, their was no plug for the second light! The bath room is nice however the tub has a few rusty stains... But the only real downside: Very expensive WiFi, which frequently disconnects and asks for registration over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at diamond head hotel”
Reviews.Author: meluk21
Reviews.Content: After moving on after 4 nights at Shelter Island we arrived early by taxi at Diamond Head, We were able to go to the straight to the room, The rooms were very good & better than expected. The hotel was ideal for the beach & visiting other places by bus which stopped at the end of the road.Coming from England it was good that the reception staff were helpful in giving us information. We had originally booked for 7 nights but stayed for an extra 4 nights as well. I was slightly disappointed with the weather for November ( it was only in the low 60s) but we still got around places without a car as the bus/trolley/coaster services were good & cheap. I would recomend this hotel but you would better to come earlier in the year when the weather is better.

Reviews.Title: “seconds to the beach”
Reviews.Author: macambo
Reviews.Content: Hotel location adjoins boardwalk. Only 2 of 21 rooms have balcony overlooking ocean .Rm201 & 202. Reserve these well in advance. Recent remodel - bold new granite kitchen/bedroom cabinet tops, new carpet, fresh paint&seascape decor. Staff helpful/friendly. Very clean rooms. Parking never easy this close to beach. Parking offered at sister hotel 2 blocks away. Homeless Vets that live around beach are harmless. Down/out former voice of Donald Duck will take change for hand sculpted palm frond flowers. City life guard/beach ranger runs tight ship- no glass bottles, no alcohol, no fires, no smoking , no boom boxes, no overnight sleeping- these rules do not apply if you are homeless vet. Ralph's super, CVS pharm. -3 blocks from hotel. You can get a better deal for price. No vacancy during my 5 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just seconds from the beach!”
Reviews.Author: feetpeet
Reviews.Content: The room has all you need, we had a queen bed, kitchenette with eat in area and bathroom with a large closet. Everything was in good condition except for the carpet, I think that should probably be replaced in the next year or so just to give the place a nice new look. Our only complaint was the walls are very thin, you can hear people beside, outside and right on top of you, when booking I would ask for the quietest room, maybe on the top floor? The front desk was great, they let us check-in early and check-out late and were very helpful about it. The location is great, you only need to walk a minute to get to Pacific Beach, a walk down the boardwalk will take you Mission Beach, a bunch of restaurants and a fun fair.

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: AZPenguin
Reviews.Content: Small place but great location. Can find a cheap room to rest and clean up. Close to beach, bars, restaurants - all walking distance. Parking is on the street and fills up fast (competing with beach-goers too). We checked in late at 10PM and were so lucky to grab a spot from someone who was leaving at the same time. Fills up quick so will probably need to book early. I didn't like how "open" I felt the property was, but slept with the windows open anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DebMcG26
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel right by the ocean. Let's talk about some of the concerns. Homeless folks..a few here and there but they don't bother anyone (compare to the drunken college kids at mission beach who can be horrible). I guess if I were homeless, I'd live by the ocean. San Diego overall has a huge homeless problem. Never felt unsafe here, Rooms - a little worn but super clean (and i'm a clean freak) and spacious. If I stayed here again I'd do 2nd floor ocean view so I would have balcony. Bed was comfy and did a thorough check for bugs, none! Noise-right by the beach walk so active til about ten. No matter where you stay you get the rude loud people, slept good here. Parking-it's Cali so always short but we found a place and stuck there. There is a lot of cafes and restaurants within walking distance, including a Starbucks and grocery store. Staff was very nice and helpful, especially Jesse at check in. The ice machine was out but they kept ice in office so I always could get some. This is a nice hotel on the ocean away from the party scene. We really liked it here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place”
Reviews.Author: chrisk1616
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been going here every summer for the past ten or so years and this is the first time I have written a review. I'm sick of reading all these negative reviews from people just complain to complain. "A stain on a carpet"? Come on! What house does not have one single stain? The cleaning staff was always asking to tiddy room. Do you really need your linens changed everyday? We stay four to five days and don't expect this. "Parking is poor", well welcome to a So Cal beach city. Imagine how the locals feel. We have always parked right in front. We park day one and WALK everywhere. That's the beauty of this hotel. Where else in Mission Beach can you stay 20 yards from the beach at such affordable rates? NO WHERE!! "You can hear people talking" Then don't stay on the boardwalk at a popular beach. Go stay at a Motel 6 on Hotel Circle instead. "No utensils" Yeah, well people steal of break. Yeah, over time we have noticed less, but you know what, we bring our own and they don't know unless people tell them. "There is no pool" Um, hello?? There is this thing called the Pacific Ocean right in front of you. I just want people to know that this is a nice little "diamond in the rough" find. The front staff is friendly. One girl even attempted to find us a special store on-line, however we did not want or need to bother, given how busy she was. The offer was good enough. I think some people just expect too much. This is a great hotel right on the beach with nothing but great sights and sounds of the ocean and seagulls. We will keep coming back, year after year. Hope this helps at least one person make the right decision.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: philippeCiney
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in this hotel (may 2011) : price is ok, suite is large and clean (not new, of course) and the location is perfect (a few steps from the beach and a lot of restaurants in the area) and...yes, parking your car may be a problem...(in May, I've always found a place)... No pool but a good (very) light breakfast every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: cactusdad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights and thought the place was great! I have read some of the negative reviews and wonder if they have the right property no way that bad!! We have stayed in some "chain" places that were dumps and this in in no way a dump. The room was clean and the location is great!! parking is an issue all over the beach area, so if you have to park a block away so be it! the bottom line is this, if you want the 4 Seasons go there, if you want a nice place to get away here you go. Can't please everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Check out your room before bringing in your luggage...”
Reviews.Author: Cedar240
Reviews.Content: This was an expierence...Not one that I will forget anytime soon...Had checked out the room but my biggest mistake was not to check to see if the electricity was working...Had dinner plans with friends and none of the bathroom lights were working...except for one...could not blow dry my hair could not use my curling iron...Walked to the front desk...they sent Filippe...who was wonderful...he left saying everything works now...He even moved the refrigerator away from the wall so he could turn it on...That was not working either...but Filippe made it happen....Then this is when the fun begins..Tried curling my hair for a 2nd time..plug not working, went to the front desk..The front desk clerk tried to fix it also..she even went to the breaker box...Is it working she asked I yelled back NO...She tried again...No I responded.....I tried to use the kitchen plug IT WQRKED.. Problem no mirrow but I had a compact in my purse...ok this is not working...I told the front desk clerk again by walking to the front office...I really need to be out of here in 10 minutes and I still cannot get it to work...So she suggested I go to room 107 and use their bathroom to curl my hair..GREAT I THOUGHT...NOT It was hot in that room...I can't handle this...Again I went back to the front desk as instructed...I am done in room 107. I explained.....At that point I was so done...It felt like an episode of Lucy .......Check your plugs, turn on all the lights and make sure your fridge is working or call Fillippe and ask him to turn it on for you...and then make sure you pack beer and wine....cause you made need a cold one after all the funning around you may to do...

Reviews.Title: “Like This Hotel But Will Have to Weigh Pros & Cons Next Time”
Reviews.Author: ROSE4059
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time staying at Diamond Head Inn. First time was wonderful but this time not so much. Now I will say that the rooms I had both times were very nice, clean and comfortable. The location can not be beat. Just a quick walk across the parking lot and you are at the boardwalk walkway AND steps away from the beach. This was the main reason I picked this hotel the first time I stayed and what drew me to it again this last trip. The abundance of homeless people hanging out is something to consider but it not the hotel's problem to solve. And being a single woman staying at this hotel I can honestly say I did not feel that my safety was in jeopardy. I'm not one for hanging out at the bars or being out alone after dark so this a non-issue for me. Now if you are looking for a place right at the beach and close to resturants and a nice walk to Belmont Park then this is the place. The cons would have to be that if there is a problem AFTER HOURS when the office closes then you are suppose to call their sister property- which I was never told nor is it posted anywhere in the room- until AFTER I had a problem. The problem was a group of drunk & extremely noisy people in a room directly across from my room and in a room downstairs across from my room. These people decided it was ok to yell, talk loudly and carry on from 1am-3:30am. IF I had been told or had known to call the sister property I surely would have. But unfortunately I just had to lay in bed and listen to them. Again being a woman alone in the hotel there was no way I was going to open my door and say anything to them. I did slam my windows closed but that had no effect- it only made my stay in the room stuffy and warm, even with the overhead fan on. The next morning I did go down and voice my complaint and was told they would inform the manager. No offer of any refund was given. Thankfully I was checking out that morning- I was tired, cranky and irritable. After waiting about a week and not hearing anything from the management I decided to write a letter. THAT did the trick and I received a call from Jim Silva the manager- who told me that he had just put a partial refund back on my card for the inconvienence and apologized. I was happy that he did call and for the refund. My only suggestion to Jim is to PLEASE post in the rooms that if there is a problem when their office is closed to please call their sister property and list the phone number. It sure would help knowing that is what to do and to have the sister property's phone number accessible to call. I can't even remember what the sister property's name is so it would have been impossible to even look it up at 2am. One other thing I need to agree with is one reviewer mentioned that they had emailed the property and asked about an upgrade and got no response. I also did this- in fact I sent off 2 emails and never got a response. If Diamond Head Inn isn't going to answer emails then don't put an email address on the website. That's just plain bad customer service and doesn't instill one ounce of confidendence to prospective customers. Overall I will say that even though this hotel has a few issues they need to address it is a really nice place to stay and you can't beat the location for being near the ocean and in the heart of Pacific Beach/Mission Beach shopping & resturants. I'd love to stay here again next time I visit San Diego but have to admit I'll be checking around at other properties before making my decision.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - dirty, overpriced and disinterested staff”
Reviews.Author: bollidear
Reviews.Content: So having read all the TripAdvisor reviews - we were looking forward to our 6 days at the Diamond Head Inn. Ok, some some reviews were extremely negative - but most were very positive. There lies the issue. Don't believe all you read!! We booked into the small untidy office and collected the room key. As soon as we entered the room (110), we were in total darkness and no light switch. After opening the blinds and turning on all the sidelights (this was at 3pm), it became obvious why dark would have been better. The carpet was badly stained in several places, pillows were off white with stains, walls had shoe scuffs on them and the chair was badly stained. It's at this stage you look deeper. The vertical wall radiators were filthy with dust/dirt/grime on every element and the place just felt dirty. Even the wall picture above the bed was broken. The back door opens out to a very dubious rear footpath and the rear windows have no security on them at all. Rear door just has a standard lock on it. Kitchen utensils can be counted on one hand. We asked to see another room, that was even smaller though marginally less stained - with the staff being entirely indifferent to our issues with filth and staining. Time to call Hotels.com for a full refund and get the hell out of the dump. I read a lot about the wonderful staff offering up a valuable car parking space. But lets figure this one out. The Hotel only has 4 spaces allocated to it - when it has 21 rooms. The Manager thinks its ok to suggest having to use parking facilities several blocks away - and yet reviewers have thanked staff for moving their cars to allow them to park????? So you think Diamond Head is cheap? Think again. You have to pay $7.95 a day for internet and will probably have to park several blocks away. We got a reservation at the Dana om Missionary Bay for the SAME price as the Diamond Head. If you have already booked or are still going to book - CHECK THE ROOM OUT FIRST. Also book with someone with clout who will ensure you get a 100% refund - like hotels.com. A final note - I emailed the Hotel 3 times before we arrived to inquire up an upgraded room - not one email was replied to. This may be a great hotel for surf bums, who will likely be too smashed out of their heads to notice the filth - but with age comes an expectation of what a Hotel should be - and clean is usually top of the list. It amazes me that there are so many positive reviews for what is a dump of an establishment. It has tainted our faith that all the reviews are "genuine" but not that the negative reviews do follow a common thread.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of the price they quote you”
Reviews.Author: Blondie58az
Reviews.Content: I really liked the hotel itself. I have stayed there at least three times before and have been satisfied. HOWEVER, they lied to me twice about the price of the stay. I called to add a one nights stay and was told it would not cost anything extra because I had Triple AAA. When I got there they said that person was NEW but didn't even suggest a compromise for the extra nights stay. THEN I had to check out early and apparently the same NEW person ran my credit card for one amount minus the one nights stay which I thought was their compromise. I was not told there would be an extra charge on my credit card for that night. When I got home they charged the extra amount. I think this is very POOR customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for everybody”
Reviews.Author: RomanSad
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - 5 minutes from wonderful beach. Parking on site. We've booked a room which turned out to be an apartment with a fully equipped small kitchen!!! Beach is wonderful, wide and sandy. You can take a long walk in both directions. In my opinion this is great place for everybody: couples, families, elder people. Restaurants and stores are within a walking distance. Good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great customer Service”
Reviews.Author: RUBillsfan
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to an oceanfront room which I definitely recommend highly. The location is great although parking could be an issue. However, the young lady at the hotel desk found us parking and even moved her own car so we could park. The rooms are ok...your typical run of the mill accommodations. they do have full kitchens which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: newyorkyankees4818
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beyond our expectations! We travelled with our two kids and booked a suite. The staff was very helpful and kind. The beach is right there. Our room had a kitchenette which was convenient for making breakfast for the family. The beach is gorgeous and the weather was great!! This hotel is very close to restaurants and shops. I am definitely coming back here again when I come to San Diego!!

Reviews.Title: “awesome location with great value&wonderful customer service”
Reviews.Author: nabeellosangeles
Reviews.Content: i was very impressed by the great location of the hotel.The front desk people are very kind&eager to please.The rooms are very clean&up to date.The hotel is located a few feet away from the boardwalk so you don't need to wear your shoes to get to the beach.I definitely enjoyed my stay&I will be back many times.

Reviews.Title: “No need for a night light”
Reviews.Author: EJJONES
Reviews.Content: Entrance to hotel room was very well lit at night. Unfortunately, the porch light shined into our hotel room, after dark, so brightly it was difficult to sleep. Our studio hotel room was too well lit up. Thank goodness I had eye covers! Otherwise, we were very pleased with our room, which was well maintained, clean and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best in PB”
Reviews.Author: maxtundy
Reviews.Content: This is the best little Inn I have ever stayed in. Me and my wife had so much fun staying here so close to the beach, clubs and an endless supply of places to eat. I plan on coming back to the PB often and will most likely always stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Would have liked some sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Xandra85242
Reviews.Content: When I arrived there was absolutely nowhere to park. I was told by the registration desk person that there are only four parking spaces for the hotel, and the rest is first come first served. She invited me to park at the sister facility several blocks away and haul my luggage back across town. I drove around until a parking place came open. The room was very nice but there was no view at all. Right across the very small hall (?) a couple of young women were staying and they were in and out, talking on the phone outside and pounding on doors and slamming doors all night long - until 4:30 a.m. Called the front desk to see if anybody could get them to quiet down and nobody answered the phone. I liked the location and the room but the rest of it was not worth the $149 I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Cupid sucks trip”
Reviews.Author: TulsaK
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was in the middle of everything in Pacific beach near the beach and located right on the board walk in Pacific beach. All the bars are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “MUCH NICER PLACES FOR THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: luv4lif
Reviews.Content: I booked a reservation at this hotel after reading the other positive reviews of this hotel. I seriously don't know what hotel those folks were staying at because this place was a dump!. The first problem was that there is no where to park. If you aren't lucky enough to get one of the 4 spots in front of the hotel, then you have to park in the beach parking area. The problem with this is that you have to move your car between 3 am - 6 am. Their solution was to park 2 blocks away at their sister facility. Our room was run down and in the back of the hotel- so our view was the back of a wall and a vending machine. The staff were rude. The hotel is on the board walk. However to get to the beach you have to pass the public bathrooms and then walk down 50- 60 stairs...try carrying beach chairs and umbrella down that! Basically this is just a glorified motel. We ended up leaving and found a room at Ocean Park Inn- I am sooooo glad we did this. For an $80 increase we had a beautiful room with a balcony, directly on the boardwalk/beach, fantastic location to shopping, restaurants, bars, etc. Wireless internet. Secured, under-ground parking. The staff was absolutely incredible! Ocean Park Inn has my repeat business in the bag!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place if you dont mind terrible management”
Reviews.Author: PhoeinxBeachbum66
Reviews.Content: The rooms are pretty nice and its a good distance from beach. People who work there (including management) apparently lack common sense and any business ethics. I ended up staying the remaining 5 out of my 6 nights at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little value spot”
Reviews.Author: jak834
Reviews.Content: All of the good reviews are right on. Our sons have stayed here several times and they said we had to stay right near the beach for $104 through Orbitz. What a great location. We rented bikes nearby to ride on the ocean blvd. The breakfast is very simple at the hotel but walk down about 4 blocks south on the ocean blvd to Kono's restaurant at 704 Garnet Ave. It doesn't look like much but the line is out the door ( we got there earlier once and only 4 in line). Great food. My wife and I shared one of the big breakfasts and we couldn't finish it all. I think it was about $5-6. There's a little seating area acrossed from the cafe where you can sit and look out at the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Best week ever”
Reviews.Author: jessrae88
Reviews.Content: For spring break my boyfriend and I decided to get away for the week. He was the one who found the hotel. It really is a nice place for the cost. Nice cozy kitchen area with microwave and stove top as well as a mini fridge with freezer. The bed is amazingly soft, I actually looked at the brand so I could invest in one! There wasn't much of a view from our room, but the beach is literally right outside. Continental breakfast does come with the room, however keep in mind - its CONTINENTAL! There are only a few selections of pastries and occasionally muffins as well as orange juice and coffee. I would recommend buying some eggs or pancake mix so you can make your own breakfast. Parking is very limited, there are designated spots but not enough for each guest. You are able to park at the "sister" hotel a few blocks down, its actually a nice walk. The only major downside of our stay was that there is no AC. by leaving the windows open you can create a nice cross breeze but i who wants to leave their room unsecured while their out? It was quite miserable when returning for the night - very hot and stuffy. Location was perfect, down town San Diego, Sea World, and San Diego Zoo are all less than ten miles (about 15min car ride depending on traffic). Overall it was a very enjoyable weekend. The maid service was very nice and did a great job. The receptionist was very kind as well. I would defiantly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MichelleDeal
Reviews.Content: would never stay here again... there is NO PARKING.... they have 4 spots for the hotel but i noticed the surfers park there and the hotel does nothing about it... even after i brought it to their attention. there is NO internet access, not even for pay.... NO ACCESS our toliet stopped up in the middle of the night and WE had to go get a plunger and fix it. would not recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: reddebs
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Honeymoon at the Diamond Head Inn and it was just lovely!! We had a two room suite complete with a kitchen - (with a view of the ocean from front windows. (Even though it wasn't considered an "ocean view" room). It's clean, recently remodled, well decorated and even though it didn't have AC - it was nice and chilly - especially at night (the way we Tucsonan's like it ;). The ocean is just steps away and there are tons of places to eat (Hennessey's - yum) within a short walk. It can be a bit noisey with the windows open - but I am sure that would be the case with any hotel this close to the ocean. There will always be surfers, joggers and tourists walking to and from the boardwalk. The staff were just fine. They weren't overly friendly, but not in the least bit rude. I found this to be the case with most of the servers, store clerks - etc. Most "locals" seemed completely uninterested in where we came from or why we were there. Oh well - who cares? This hotel is a steal for the money!! Ask for room 208 if the "ocean view" rooms are sold out. It's soooo worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for location”
Reviews.Author: 1life-liveit
Reviews.Content: This place is perfect for the beach lover. No need to hire a car when staying here as the number 30 bus at the corner of the street will take you to Old Town where you can get around so easily. The place is comfortable, not plush and some staff just give off the feeling they can't be bothered to help you but this place is all about location. Don't think you will get an ocean view unless you phone to reserve way in advance, infact they only give ocean view rooms ( there are 2 ) to those who phone to book. They won't call a cab for you or help you out with change but as i said this place is about location. There are some great places to eat within a 5 min walk. For burger and beer go to Bareback. Also the Thai is excellent even though it looks like a cafe the food is supreme and take away is great when you just wanna go back to your room and chill. This location is second to non and you will find yourself being drawn back to go sit on Pacific beach and while away the hours watching the relentless surfers and joggers. After all that you can have a great nights sleep in comfy bed and fall asleep to the fans that constantly click when in motion but are needed 24 7.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Difficult Parking”
Reviews.Author: broadcast9
Reviews.Content: I booked one room here because the price was better than other beachfront hotels. The room is clean- slightly dated- and the amenities are not modern- but acceptable. They upgraded me from the single room to the suite with a balcony facing the beach- so my review may be biased. But the view is phenomenal and the location is great. The balcony in the suite is large and sufficient for 4-6 people. I loved working on the balcony- and keeping the windows open. (No bugs like in Florida) The sound of the waves was serene- and the temperature was perfect. I can't speak as to how the interior smaller rooms are- but my sta was well worth the money. My only compaint is that there is limited parking as it is- about 6 spots plus numerous public spots nearby. However, in watching over the last two days- most of the people parking in the hotel spots are not staying at the hotel. I never once saw anyone check the parking - tow trucks or hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price... BUT”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirl1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "nicest room" for a week (May 16-23rd '08.) I grew up in this Pacific Beach & was visiting for the first time in 15 years. My main priority when chooseing this hotel was #1 price, #2 proximity to the Beach (i'm not a pool person). 1st: Our initial surprise was the NO A/C since it was 90 when we arrived. Slowly that became no big deal since we had the 2nd floor ocean facing room & the breeze from the ocean cooling our room off quickly. At night how ever this was a problem because you could not close the door & block out the outdoor boardwalk & parking lot noise. Also there was no screen on the balcony sliding door just a sheer curtain, luckily no sparrows or bugs really got in the room. 2nd: Our room did face the ocean BUT before the ocean was a parking lot, then a grassy knoll where the bums LIVED & then the ocean. So the view was a little not so great or private feeling. 3rd: The "contential breakfast" was pretty weak! Coffee & doughnuts, a muffin or pastry maybe, & juice. I guess I was expecting the best western level of food. Hit Kono's at the Boardwalk & Garnet... the Best breakfast in PB & cheap. Sit inside on windy days & enjoy a surfing video or take it outside to the patio off the pier over the ocean... You can't beat it! On the up side the room & kitchen was decent sized & well equipped. Overall Diamond Head inn: you get what you pay for. Great location, as far as in the center of it all, but not a secluded or romantic. Feels very exposed to the parking lot & baordwalk. But close to Garnet Ave. Beach etc. But great price considering the Pacific Terrace next door charges $400+ a night. Not sure that I would book this place again or suggest friends to stay there for more than a day or two & would definitely not suggest staying in the other rooms where your windows open off the main walkway. Spring for this room if your going to this place! Weather was a little shaky, 85 & 90's & sunny one day & then 3 days of clouds & 55. May & June are prone to Fog & what locals call "June Gloom" so avoid if you've never been there. SD Overall: PB & La Jolla are the best that San Diego have to offer... PB is more surfer, laid back, the BEST Beach & college partiers. LJ more lush, beautiful, secluded cove beaches. I highly suggest any traveler to take La Jolla BLvd. North from PB into LJ & explore along the coast on the side roads. The beautiful beaches & homes are spectacular! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: amz1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 4 nights at this hotel at then end of last month. The hotel is right on the beach, close to restaurants and bars. The price of this hotel is very reasonable and I would recommend it to anyone visiting San Diego. Despite what others say its very easy to get around San Diego without a car. Theres a bus stop at the end of the hotels street . Buses come frequently and will take you to downtown SanDiego or the Old town. A great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for the price!”
Reviews.Author: chaunacey
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Diamond Head for five nights with our two year old. We booked a promotional rate on the website and ended up paying $69/night, an unbelievable price considering the amenities, neighborhood and proximity to the beach. We requested a one bedroom suite and mentioned that we would be two adults and one child. They accomodated us well by putting us in a room with two queen beds (I didn't even see this option listed). I thought that was a nice touch. The lobby area isn't impressive, but who spends time in the lobby. The rooms are very nicely decorated and clean. The kitchenettes are very newly remodeled and have granite countertops and table. It was a very comfortable room (despite the lack of air conditioning). It was in the low 50s on the first night and we couldn't get our wall heater to work. A maintenance person came within minutes of reporting the problem and it was fixed immediately. The temperature ended up in the high 80s on the last day of our trip and to be honest the room was uncomfortably warm. I was glad we were packing up that day. The continental breakfast was muffins, awful coffee, and "juice." Fortunately, we went to Trader Joe's on our first night and stocked up on breakfast items, so just used the muffins as a snack. The kitchennetes have a stove-top, full-size microwave, a small fridge, and sink. I think that adding pantry staples such as cooking spray, salt, and pepper would be a good idea, because cooking eggs on old teflon pans isn't always tasty. We never had a problem parking within one block of the hotel during our six day stay. I'm sure this becomes more of a problem during the late summer, but it wasn't an issue for us at all. The only major complaint that I have is that there was no internet AT ALL. The website lists "wired" internet as an amenity. This would have been a serious problem if my husband couldn't connect his computer to the internet through his Blackberry. I wouldn't have booked there at all had I known they didn't offer internet. This oversight needs to be immediately updated on their website. I'm glad however, that we stayed at the Diamond Head Inn. The price was exceptional. I've paid far more to stay in far less luxurious accomodations and this was a fantastic surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Loaction”
Reviews.Author: kerrylauralyn
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised with this little wonder. We stayed at The Diamond Head Inn last weekend and for the price and location I would say it's tough to beat for something so close to the beach. Parking is not that bad if you know when most of the surfers come and go. We got a great spot and walked to every destination the rest of the weekend. The picture that is on their website is actually not of the hotel but of the vacation rentals located directly behind it. It's a very small place but the rooms are big, kitchen is great and the bathroom was not that bad. Only problem we had was that our remote did not work but that did not bother us much since we were in and out of the room often. There were some weekend partiers but it didn't seem to bother me. We will be back next time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Becky Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: BKIND
Reviews.Content: we got into town late after 9:00 pm and were looking for a place to stay. our local favorites were either booked or $275-$440 a night. so we stopped at the Diamond Head Inn and spoke to the night manager who was waiting for some guests to show up. they were all booked up except for the arriving late arrivals. did Becky simply send us away? no! she took the time to call around and find us another hotel that was not only close but very reasonably priced. mind you, this was late at night and this is what I call going the extra mile with a smile. Becky deserves a big raise. oh...the rooms and grounds looked well updated and well-kept.

Reviews.Title: “Good find,comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: Rabbit12
Reviews.Content: As previous posts stated, this place is in a great location: turn left and the promenade is right there! Pacific Beach in winter was pleasant, not crowded but not deserted. The bed was comfy, and there was extra seating and an old style banquette in the kitchen area. Small bathroom and a tub that needed reglazing, but it was all clean, and we were pleased enough to stay 5 days. Ground floor units have a rear door that lets you out between buildings, and it was a plus one morning when we had to retrieve our parked car, about a block away. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: bfunk3143
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom suite with kitchenette. What a great location!! So good there were never any parking spaces. I noticed there were cars parked for the hotel that never left the entire time we were there (work trucks etc). Would lead me to believe there were residents in the neighborhood using the lot. As we had to wake up hour on the hour to try to find a spot!! One night we even said FORGET IT as we couldn't find anywhere to park (yes in January) and gambled with being towed!! It would be worth the owners time and money to find alternatives for his guests. Rooms were great, staff was horrible. I don't think I got two words from front desk during checkin or check out!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Jan K
Reviews.Content: We visit San Diego several times a year and always stay at Diamond Head Inn. We love having a kitchenette plus being so close to the boardwalk. The rooms are large and convenient to places in the area. Walking the board walk is a must both for exercise and experiencing the "culture". GThere are great restaurants along the way plus great coffee places. The continental breakfast isn't much but at least something to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but they messed up big time”
Reviews.Author: MrsDre
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through this hotels website dirrectly in August 12 for our upcoming stay in September. I had a confirmation number and they sent me an e-mail confirming the dates and rate. When we arrived there on September 13th, they had no record of our reservation. I showed them the email that I had printed out with the confirmation number and the desk person said that it didn't help him at all. He then asked me if I called the hotel to confirm it, I said no isn't that the point of the hotel sending me the email with a confirmation number? He then told us that they are completly booked and there was nothing he could do. He went on to blame the problem in the corporate office who runs the online booking. He said they didnt enter us into the system. We were in San Diego for a wedding the next day and we had to be ready early the next day. So he said there was a sister property 2 blocks down and they had a room available and sent us down there. When we got the the Pacific shores inn, their sister property, they did not have any rooms available for us and sent us back to the Diamond head inn. The desk clerk told us that he could put us in a room at the Diamond head inn for one night and then they would figure it out in the morning. So the room we were in was ok, but we reserved a 2 room suite with a kitchen. We got a 1 room with 2 queens. Not very comfortable for us. The next day they sent us to the Pacific shores inn, and that place was terrible. You can see my review of that place under Pacific shores inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Belgotraveler
Reviews.Content: I went on a weekend trip to San Diego with my girlfriend (both 28) and had actually booked a room with the sister location, Pacific Shores Inn due to the fact that in this price range I was concerned that the Diamon Head Inn had no permanent parking or swimming pool. I'm a big traveler but have not stayed in many hotels myself nor had I explored San Diego close to the beach. If you're in your 20s, maybe 25-30 I think you would find the place to be adequate. The pros are the location. Had no clue it would be so perfectly located for what we were looking for. There are reviews with complaints about the steps,etc but you're literally a minute away from the beach. Other pros are that the rooms were fairly big and upgraded., there's a nice convenient small kitchen area and refrigerator to store some drinks. The cons are unfortunately small details that more seasoned travelers might want to avoid with reason. Our television, not a priority I'll admit did not get any channels, the ceiling fan was wobbling and made a noise that was tolerable but annoying. Upon arrival our room was "ready" but there were no soaps or shampoos available for a shower. I didn't find noise to be an issue though I could have possibly been more upset that somehow we were transfered from one hotel that we chose to this one without knowing what it was going to be like. It's located right next to the Pacific Terrace Hotel that I would definitely recommend if you can fit it in your budget. Rooms seemed modern, large balconies and a nice pool that was semiprivate from the boardwalk. Our room cost us $140/Mid-May for comparison reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kladybug
Reviews.Content: I must admit that after reading the reviews, I was sceptical. However, this hotel was in an excellent location, right on the boardwalk at Mission Beach. Like all other travellers, the parking is an issue but in December, we didn't have a problem but I'm sure parking in the summer is a nightmare. The hotel was very clean and quiet. The room as very big. Kono's for breakfast is a must! Great homebase for exploring San Diego. We did have an issue with the phones. Someone was trying to reach us and the phone just rang and rang, no one at the front desk all the time and the phone's are not forwarded to an answering service. We did have a wonderful holiday and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room - unless you are a surfer and just came to party and surf.”
Reviews.Author: djazzy
Reviews.Content: There is NO air conditioning and the ceiling fan in the first room did not work so they moved us to a little dinky room in the back of the hotel. It was H O T !!! The windows are small but do open - still not much air. The staff is great considering what they have to work with. It is right on the beach - if you don't mind walking down about 65 steps to get to the beach...and back up! We were very unhappy and would have moved if we could have located another hotel. They discounted our room from $160 to $110 so we stayed. The sofa bed was broken but we needed two beds so we switched off and one of us got the sofa bed every other night. Would not go there again - and - would not recommend it to anyone over the age of 22.

Reviews.Title: “Truely enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Diamond Head Inn. The staff was very kind, friendly and knowledgeable about the area. Breakfast offers pasteries, juice and coffee just enough to get our day started. Each room had ceiling fans and most of the windows opened. There was some noise our first night, but it is to be expected staying this close to the beach. The parking is limited, but we never had a problem finding a spot.

Reviews.Title: “A decent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews of this hotel before we stayed there. We found that most of the comments- good and bad - were quite accurate. Most other reviewers have mentioned noise as a problem. I found that sound did carry very easily but, luckily, there were no party animals there during our stay. Despite the overall good quality of the room, it did display some examples of slipshod maintenance. The safety chain on the entry door was broken, the cover on the bathroom exhaust fan was held on by crudely applied masking tape and a lot of sunlight could be seen out of the rear door, which exits into a small alley ( the door was not hung properly). Some people would be bothered by these imperfections; we weren't. The location is fantastic. It is a few dozen steps from the beach and the boardwalk. This feature makes it a popular spot for the surfing fraternity. As a result, street parking is not always available and the hotel does not have its own parking facilities. The neighbourhood does have a variety of decent, roadhouse- style restaurants. If a modest price and an attractive locale are very important to you, you will probably enjoy this hotel. If a high level of service and top notch facilities are your main consideration, you may want to look at a more expensive hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Diamond Head Inn for spring break. The rooms were surprisingly nice. The room was clean and roomy. The most convienent part was the location. You are right on the beach at the beginning of the boardwalk close to shops, restaurants, bars and pretty much anything you need. The hotel was loud for 2 out of the 6 nights but not for extended periods of time. Parking is limited, but we got a parking spot all but 1 night...there is parking at the pacific shores inn 2 blocks down the street. Overall its a great choice for a clean room, good location and a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place close to the ocean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from Feb 18-Feb 22,2006. It was a very nice motel. With the bus stop only 2 blocks away and also a Denny's restraunt 2 blocks away. Because of a flight delay we didnt get in until 1:30a.m. I called ahead and am glad I did because the office closed at 11:00p.m. and so they brought the room keys to their sister motel. Rooms were very nice and less than $75.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy at night, got little sleep, nice room”
Reviews.Author: SandybottomPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Diamond Head Inn over the Labor Day weekend in a room on the ground level. Room was clean, bed comfortable, nice kitchenette. Getting a decent night's sleep was something else altogether. We had several people occupying the room directly above us who spent a good part of the first night drinking, stomping about and cursing. At one point, someone or something hit the floor above us hard enough to rattle the lamps on our bedside table. Calls to the desk went unanswered. We complained to a nice young lady at the office the next morning and she asked us to call the Pacific Shores if it happened again as they share security. The next night was a repeat - we called - security came - our neighbors cursed the guard, quieted down, resumed the racket - we confronted them ourselves - we were cursed - finally at about 3am things quieted down. Another night's sleep shot. We wrote a letter detaling our experiences to the general manager upon our return home and never received a reply. For having nice rooms at their location, you'd think the Diamond Head Inn would have a security person on duty, especially over a holiday weekend. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, excellent value, noisy neighbors”
Reviews.Author: ReniassanceMan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a couple of evenings in San Diego at the Diamond Head Inn. The last couple of trips we've stayed at the Pacific Terrace, which we really enjoy, but its a little pricey at $250+. The Diamond Head Inn is right across the street and looked a little more casual, which it is. Our bottom floor suite ($99/night) included a nice sized bedroom, kitchen w/appliances and silverware/dishes, and a living room area with nice sized TV plus a separate bathroom. It was very clean and nicely decorated and had obviously been remodeled and updated recently. Thursday night was quiet even though the beach access and parking was just a few steps away. Friday about 2 a.m. a few young adults with loud voices and limited vocabulary took up residence on the stairwell outside our bedroom window apparently visiting one of the occupants of one of the other rooms. Calls to the office weren't answered and there didn't seem to be any security on premise. I figured they would wear themselves out which they did about 4-4:30 but the night was shot. We'll probably go back with the whole family the next time and hope for the best since I think the room will work well with the fold out couch and you can't beat the price. I'd like to see the management have security patrol the area on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: emasl
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 9 nights and had a great time. I booked this from the UK for an incredible $500 each, inc taxes, and breakfast. I had been staying at the Marriott in San Diego the previous week for a conference and this was a total contrast but we loved it. Rooms had obviously been refurbished and everything was immaculate. Great maid service every day, helpful staff and totally close to the beach. Only downside was that as other reviewers have said, it can be noisy but we only had one bad night. For value for money this cannot be beaten. Shop around on internet sites for best value, I saved us $200 each by doing this Elaine - UK

Reviews.Title: “Don't plan on sleeping”
Reviews.Author: PTVT
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Diamond Head...never again. Negatives..NOISY.. HOT.. lousy mattress. Positives ...Kid working front office did her best to accommodate us..gave us different room ...our first room on the 2nd fllor looked directly into the room of a group of partying twenty year olds. You would never know you are near the ocean trying to sleep here. All you hear is traffic and loud kids till the wee hours.

Reviews.Title: “Not what was promised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2004 with my husband and 2 children. Was told by reservations that I booked a 2 room suite (each room having its own tv), that the hotel had been completely remodeled, there was parking in the street which would be no problem as it was not summer yet, and there was a complimentary continental breakfast available in the morning. We checked into our room which had a tiny room with a very uncomfortable fold out sofabed and a small tv, the bedroom was so small we could hardly walk by the bed to the bathroom and there was no tv in the bedroom. The room had been remodeled but it was very poorly lit and the bathroom was very tiny. We went back to the front desk to change our room but was told we got the last one. We had the unfortunate luck of having someone celebrating her 21st birthday so at 2am we heard loud yelling, cursing, etc... from the party. As there was no number to call for the front desk, my husband had to walk outside to the front desk. No one was there but there was a number of who to call in an emergency. We called the off-site manager and told him about the noise and he said he would do something about it. At 4am the noise continued so again we called back. We would have called the police but there was no phone book to look up the number. After a horrible night's sleep, we checked out in the morning and complained about our room and that we were not given what was told to us by their reservations agent. The manager did apologize about the noise but what could he do. The continental breakfast was 1 thermos of coffee, a tray of danish and a plastic pitcher of something red that looked like punch. I don't know how they could feed all their guests with that little. We never found parking near the hotel so we parked on the next street over which was a little bit of a walk. I emailed the parent company right away 2 times to complain and never heard from them. Finally I called their reservations line and she forwarded my complaint. Someone did call back from the hotel and I told him I felt deceived by the promises made by reservations and I wanted a partial refund of my price paid. He offered us a free night in the future but we would NEVER stay there again. To his credit, he did authorize a partial refund of our rate paid so at least we got something back for such a horrible stay. The only good part is that we could walk to the beach but I would never stay there again nor would I recommend this hotel to anyone! Thanks for your site which lets me tell others not to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too Hot, Too noisy”
Reviews.Author: Kadoogan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on May 1 2004. This hotel was very nicely decorated and clean and the staff was friendly however I would not stay here again because it was too hot and too noisy. The hotel doesn’t have air conditioning because they are so close to the beach however I think it reached close to 90 degrees that day. We couldn’t open the windows because the whole neighborhood was up partying the whole night. The hotel shares a cul-de-sac with some apartments whose tenets were having a roof party until 3am. The other guests in the hotel were also up till all hours of the night. I would only recommend this hotel for the winter in the middle of the week, I think this town is just a bit noisy on summer Saturday nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with our stay at the diamond head inn, you always wonder what kind of hotel you are going to get for less than $100 night. The room which included a kitchenette had recently been remodeled and was very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful and the location is excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What do You Want from your Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read many reviews that the Diamond Head Inn in San Diego is a terrible hotel and that there were many things wrong. HOWEVER, what is it that you want from your hotel? The price was incredibly inexpensive especially for being right by the beach and in southern California. From what I have read, some travellers were expecting a world class resort with five stars. The hotel and its staff never promised nor advertised such amenities. If that's what you want, then expect to pay for it. One person made the comment that he or she moved to the hotel across the street, which he or she commented as being "much nicer". Well, I noticed that the price was $100.00 more a night. That is a significant difference! The hotel marketed itself in a very professional manner and when I contacted the office, they were very honest in letting us know the amenities, location, and condition of the hotel. They told me that it was under repair but we would get a spacious room with a kitchenette. We had a suite with four separate rooms and a complete working kitchen! All this for less than $100.00 per night! We were usually outside on the beach or in town anyway and the room was more than enough to give us a place to rest at night! It was extremely safe and clean. In conclusion, the Diamond Head Inn and its staff surpassed my expections.

HotelInfo.Name: Diamond Head Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 605 Diamond St, San Diego, CA 92109
